question: Which among the following regarding NRI’s Voting rights is correct ?
option1: NRIs can not vote in parliamentary and assembly elections
option2: NRIs can not vote in parliamentary elections but can vote in assembly elections
option3: NRIs can vote in parliamentary elections but can not vote in assembly elections
option4: NRIs can vote in parliamentary as well as assembly elections
answer: NRIs can vote in parliamentary as well as assembly elections
explanation: NRIs can vote in parliamentary as well as assembly elections. An NRI is any Indian citizen who is ordinarily residing outside India and holds an Indian Passport.
